data.description: 2026 Summer Intern - Product Development Data Sciences Department SummaryProduct Development Data Sciences is a group of more than 1,000 data scientists across 5 global sites. We deliver data and insights about our medicine with excellence and passion. Our mission is to unlock the full potential of data, to accelerate innovative healthcare solutions for patients and society.This internship position is located in South San Francisco, on-site. The OpportunityInnovative study design: develop novel methods and tools for clinical drug development with potential applications in diverse therapeutic areas such as immunology, ophthalmology, neuroscience, and CVRM.Developing software tools/packages: Developing code for novel methods and run simulations. Program Highlights6 months paid internship, first 12 weeks must be full time (40 hours/week) on-site, while the rest will be part time, and can be remote or on-site, with the opportunity to extend to up to 12 months.Program start dates are in May/June 2026.A stipend, based on location, will be provided to help alleviate costs associated with the internship.Ownership of challenging and impactful business-critical projects.Work with some of the most talented people in the biotechnology industry. Who You Are (Required) Required EducationYou meet one of the following criteria:Must have attained a Master's Degree (no more than a year ago).Must be pursuing a PhD (enrolled student). Required Majors: Statistics, Biostatistics, Computer Science, Data Science, Mathematics, Biotechnology, or related fields.Required Skills:Excellent communication, collaboration, and interpersonal skills.Complements our culture and the standards that guide our daily behavior & decisions: Integrity, Courage, and Passion.Passion for learning and curious about drug development in the biotech industry.Solid training in statistics, machine learning, and/or data science.Strong programming ability in R/Python. Preferred Knowledge, Skills, and QualificationsFamiliarity with longitudinal data is a plus.Relocation benefits are not available for this job posting. The expected salary range for this position based on the primary location of California is $50.00 hour. Actual pay will be determined based on experience, qualifications, geographic location, and other job-related factors permitted by law. This position also qualifies for paid holiday time off benefits. Genentech is an equal opportunity employer. It is our policy and practice to employ, promote, and otherwise treat any and all employees and applicants on the basis of merit, qualifications, and competence. The company's policy prohibits unlawful discrimination, including but not limited to, discrimination on the basis of Protected Veteran status, individuals with disabilities status, and consistent with all federal, state, or local laws.If you have a disability and need an accommodation in relation to the online application process, please contact us by completing this form Accommodations for Applicants.
requirements: Must have attained a Master's Degree (no more than a year ago).
responsibilities: Innovative study design: develop novel methods and tools for clinical drug development with potential applications in diverse therapeutic areas such as immunology, ophthalmology, neuroscience, and CVRM.
Developing software tools/packages: Developing code for novel methods and run simulations.
6 months paid internship, first 12 weeks must be full time (40 hours/week) on-site, while the rest will be part time, and can be remote or on-site, with the opportunity to extend to up to 12 months.
A stipend, based on location, will be provided to help alleviate costs associated with the internship.
Passion for learning and curious about drug development in the biotech industry.
